1.text: Alright, team, we’ve got a fire at an apartment building. Our top priority is saving any civilians trapped inside.
1.name: Captain Hayes

2.text: Be prepared to break down doors if needed and use the hose to control the flames.
2.name: Captain Hayes

3.text: Any more questions before we head out?
3.name: Captain Hayes

6.text: Our main focus is rescuing civilians. Once everyone is safe, we can work on controlling the fire.
6.name: Captain Hayes

7.text: Any more questions before we head out?
7.name: Captain Hayes

10.text: Could you explain how our equipment works?
10.name: You

11.text: Sure, The nozzle on the hose can put out fires, but it needs to be replenished slowly. Use it carefully to manage the water supply.
11.name: Captain Hayes

12.text: The axe is for breaking down doors and clearing debris, but it’s not ideal for heavy-duty tasks. Use it when necessary to access blocked areas or remove obstacles.
12.name: Captain Hayes

13.text: Any more questions before we head out?
13.name: Captain Hayes

15.text: Can you tell me more about the teddy bear keychain you have?
15.name: You

16.text: This teddy bear keychain? It’s special to me. My daughter gave it to me.
16.name: Captain Hayes

17.text: There’s only one like it in the world. It’s a reminder of what’s truly important.
17.name: Captain Hayes

20.text: It seems like we’re here. Let’s move out and get to work.
20.name: Captain Hayes
